result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack Robert Christiansen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jack Robert Christiansen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jack Robert Christiansen was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jack Robert Christiansen

records.addlTxt:
9:39 AM Defendant Jack Robert Christiansen in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jack Robert Christiansen.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that for Count 2 in 22CF54, repeater be stricken. Count 1, count 3 and count 4 to be dismissed. For count 2 in 22CF54, 60 days jail consecutive to 21CF266 and 22CF54 with no credit and pay costs. In 20CF268, terminate Deferred agreement. For 20CF268, 9 months jail with credit of 2 days. Consecutive to 21CF266 and 22CF54. Defendant pleads no contest to Count 2 in 22CF54. Attorney Hansen stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. 

Court imposes in 20CF268, terminates deferred agreement. Withheld sentence for 2 years probation. Conditions of probation include programming by the DOC, two days jail with credit for two days and pay a $100 fine plus costs. In 22CF54 for count 2 with repeater stricken, 60 days jail with no credit. Consecutive to 21CF266 but concurrent with 20CF268 and pay a $100 fine plus costs. Counts 1, 3 and 4 are dismissed.

9:32 AM Defendant Jack Robert Christiansen in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jack Robert Christiansen.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State has made an offer. Attorney Rosenthal states close to resolution and status in a couple weeks. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jack Robert Christiansen in court.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jack Robert Christiansen. State indicates that an offer has been extended. Attorney Rosenthal indicates he is looking for State to supply some discovery. State indicates that the discovery is available for defense counsel to pick up. Asks for another status. Attorney Rosenthal is in agreement.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:38 AM Defendant Jack Robert Christiansen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jack Robert Christiansen.  Attorney Chad C La Lor appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. State notes offer has been pending. Attorney Rosenthal notes additional discovery and asks for another status. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:30 AM Defendant Jack Robert Christiansen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal appeared by video for Jack Robert Christiansen.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates offer has been extended, does not oppose additional status conference. Attorney Rosenthal asks for additional status conference on June 17.
Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:29 AM Defendant Jack Robert Christiansen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jack Robert Christiansen.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Atty Rosenthal would like to set for a Status Conference
Status conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
